001package imagingbook.lib.filter.linear;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter;
004import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterScalar;
005import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
006
007/**
008 * This class represents a 2D linear filter specified by an
009 * arbitrary 2D convolution kernel.
010 * It is based on {@link GenericFilter} and {@link GenericFilterScalar},
011 * which take care of all data copying and filter mechanics.
012 * Since it is a "scalar" filter, pixel values are treated as scalars.
013 * If the processed image has more than one component 
014 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
015 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
016 * To apply to an image, use the {@link #applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)}
017 * method, for example.
018 */
019public class LinearFilter extends GenericFilterScalar {
020
021        private final float[][] H;                      // the kernel matrix, note H[y][x]!
022        private final int xc, yc;                       // 'hot spot' coordinates
023        
024        /**
025         * Constructor. Only the 2D filter kernel (see {@link Kernel2D}) needs to be specified.
026         * 
027         * @param kernel the 2D filter kernel
028         */
029        public LinearFilter(Kernel2D kernel) {
030                this.H = kernel.getH();
031                this.xc = kernel.getXc();
032                this.yc = kernel.getYc();
033        }
034
035        @Override
036        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
037                double sum = 0;
038                for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
039                        int vj = v + j - yc;
040                        for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
041                                int ui = u + i - xc;
042                                sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[j][i];
043                        }
044                }
045                return (float)sum;
046//              return convolve(source, H, u, v, xc, yc);
047        }
048        
049//      public static float convolve(PixelSlice plane, float[][] H, int u, int v, int xc, int yc) {
050//              double sum = 0;
051//              for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
052//                      int vj = v + j - yc;
053//                      for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
054//                              int ui = u + i - xc;
055//                              sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[j][i];
056//                      }
057//              }
058//              return (float)sum;
059//      }
060
061}
